  physical_appearance: This is a batik kain panjang
 It features a bouquet of flowers set against a cream panel filled with dense scrolls on the left. The panel is bordered by a scrolling floral bloom pattern. The main body of the kain panjang is set against a blue ground
 decorated with phoenixes and a variety of tendril patterns. There is a signature at the top-left of the batik kain panjang.

  subject_terms_1: phoenixes Peranakan flower (motif) scrolls (motifs) foliage (motif)

  subject_terms_2: Motifs Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people) Batik

  subject_terms_3: Peranakan costumes Batik

  sgcool_label_text: The buketan motif (or a large bouquet of flowers) is set against a background of dense cream swirls on the kepala (broad vertical panel of the batik).  On the badan (or main design field)
 phoenixes are depicted amidst foilage and trefoil background patterns on a blue ground.  This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Djien Nio (1929-1987)
 the last in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  In her earlier signatures
 she used her husband’s name
 Liem Siok Hien.  But from 1965 onwards
 she used Jane Hendromartono
 combining her husband’s new Indonesian family name
 Hendromartono with Jane
 as people addressed her by.  She developed a personal style distinct from her mother and grandmother
 and experimented with a wide spectrum of colours and exotic combinations of birds
 rock formations and mythical animals.  Jane Hendromartono’s clientele expanded beyond the elite in Indonesia to include Europe
 America and Japan
 especially in the 1980s.  This piece is signed “Hendromartono Batik Art” Unique Pekalongan
 100% Tulis”.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a batik kain panjang, It features a bouquet of flowers set against a cream panel filled with dense scrolls on the left. The panel is bordered by a scrolling floral bloom pattern. The main body of the kain panjang is set against a blue ground, decorated with phoenixes and a variety of tendril patterns. There is a signature at the top-left of the batik kain panjang.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Motifs Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people) Batik
metadata.sgcool_label_text: The buketan motif (or a large bouquet of flowers) is set against a background of dense cream swirls on the kepala (broad vertical panel of the batik).  On the badan (or main design field), phoenixes are depicted amidst foilage and trefoil background patterns on a blue ground.  This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Djien Nio (1929-1987), the last in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  In her earlier signatures, she used her husband’s name, Liem Siok Hien.  But from 1965 onwards, she used Jane Hendromartono, combining her husband’s new Indonesian family name, Hendromartono with Jane, as people addressed her by.  She developed a personal style distinct from her mother and grandmother, and experimented with a wide spectrum of colours and exotic combinations of birds, rock formations and mythical animals.  Jane Hendromartono’s clientele expanded beyond the elite in Indonesia to include Europe, America and Japan, especially in the 1980s.  This piece is signed “Hendromartono Batik Art” Unique Pekalongan, 100% Tulis”.
